title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 351.7 - Supervisory review and approval
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 351.7 - Supervisory review and approval

State Regulations

Social services districts have the option of requiring
supervisory approval for case actions on all public assistance cases. Social
services districts that choose not to review all public assistance cases must
have a plan in place describing their requirements for supervisory approval. Such plan must be approved by the office prior to its implementation. Supervisory approval must be indicated by a dated signature in the case record. Supervisory approval must be based upon review of all available information
pertaining to eligibility and the amount of entitlement. It must include
approval of decisions to deny public assistance as well as decisions to change
grants or to refer applicants or recipients for services. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
ยง
351.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
